name: From Amazon to Zircon Quiz | Alphabetical Words | 25 Questions

questions.explanation:
autobahn.

	Or automaton, Amazon, Anton, or Antoine.

Barbizon.

	Or bonbon (candy) or boron (a metalloid element).

Canton.

	Or con or come-on.

Don.

	Or dawn or decagon.

Exxon.

	Or eon or electron.

fawn.

	Or flan, futon, or faun--a mythical creature, a kinder, gentler satyr.

gone.

	There's doggone, gone to the dogs, gone fishing, gonzo, here and gone, here today and gone tomorrow, and "Goneaway Lake," a fabulous kids' book by Elizabeth Enright.

Huron.

	The Hurons are a Native American group. Or there's Jessica Hahn, the church secretary who blew the whistle on James Bakker. Or heptagon, a seven-sided figure or hexagon, a six-sided one.

Iguanodon.

	Gideon Mantell was the first to discover fossilized Iguanodon bones. He discovered them in Ringmer, East Sussex (UK) in 1822.

questions.text: Feminine version of the French name Jean?
questions.explanation:
Jeanne.

	Or John, Jon or the Spanish name Juan or the Dutch name Jan.

Khan.

	Or the late, great comic actress Madeline Kahn. Or Superman's home, the planet Krypton.

leprechaun.

	Or mow the lawn or lawn handkerchiefs.

questions.text: An extremely tiny unit of measurement?
questions.explanation:
micron.

	Or the game of mahjong. It takes one million microns to equal a meter. A marathon is a race that is over 26 miles long.

neuron.

	Or Indian bread called naan or nonagon, a nine-sided figure.

octagon.

	Or Oregon (though many people pronounce its final syllable as if it were spelled "gun").

paragon.

	Or pantheon, pentagon, phenomenon, pawn, put-upon, or put-on.

Quan.

	In my favorite children's book series, "The Melendy Family" by Elizabeth Enright, the children's father had a Quan Yin statuette on his writing desk.

Ron.

	Or the 1950 film Rashomon, directed by Akira Kurosawa.

spawn.

	Or frogs' spawn. Or Charles Manson's home, the Spahn Ranch. Or a sawn-off shotgun.

tarragon.

	Or "What a turn-on!" as hippies used to say in the 1960s.

upon.

	Or "Once Upon a Mattress," the musical.

Vaughn.

	Vaughn played Napoleon Solo and David McCallum played Illya Kuryakin. The late, great Leo G. Carroll played their boss.

wan.

	Or whereupon or Obi-Wan Kenobi of "Star Wars."

questions.text: I'm skipping X. You do this when you're sleepy?
questions.explanation:
yawn.

	Dogs sometimes yawn when they're confused. It's a way of saying "I don't understand what's happening here."

zircon.

	Zircon, a natural stone, comes in a variety of colors, including rose, blue, yellow, and brown. It is a December birthstone and can be an October one, too.  Can you say this list very quickly? Autobahn, Barbizon, Canton, Don, fawn, gone, Huron, Iguanodon, Jeanne, Khan, leprechaun, micron, neuron, octagon, paragon, Quan, Ron, spawn, tarragon, upon, Vaughn, wan, yawn, zircon.
